extendedInfo.description: The best way to read The Economist on your Android device.The app is free to download and includes free access to the Editor's picks â a weekly selection of articles from each weekâs edition of The Economist.Digital and print subscribers to The Economist receive unrestricted access to each weekâs full print edition.FEATURESâ¢ Each weekâs issue available from 9pm London time each Thursdayâ¢ Download each issue to your device to read without an internet connectionâ¢ Switch easily between reading and listening with The Economist in audioâ¢ Store and access back issuesâ¢ Purchase single issues in appâ¢ Subscribe from within the app for full access to The Economist on Android tablets, Android smartphones, iPhone, iPad, Windows 8, BlackBerry PlayBook, BlackBerry 10 and Economist.comâ¢ Share articles via e-mail, Twitter and FacebookThe Economist on Android operates on tablets and smartphones running Gingerbread, Ice Cream Sandwich and Jelly Bean.ABOUT THE ECONOMISTThe Economist is a weekly international news and business publication, offering clear reporting, commentary and analysis on world current affairs, business, finance, science and technology, culture, society, media and the arts.SUPPORTShould you require any assistance using our app please visit http://www.economist.com/help/android for answers to frequently asked questions as well as ways to contact customer support.

reviews.comment: Going to war?
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Crashes
reviews.comment: Used to work and now it keeps crashing.... please sort out I\'m a paying subscriber! Won\'t be renewing if not fixed quickly.
reviews.author: Thierry Imbert

reviews.title: Honeycomb fail
reviews.comment: I installed the older version on Honeycomb and it worked well.  Yesterday the Honeycomb support came out, now it works not at all.  --- I bought a new tablet after losing my old one. Yes, it crashed frequently on ICS and Jellybean, however, I could still read.  However, they have decided you can\'t even install it for an unknown time-period until they get around to fixing it.  I wonder if they will support a 4.x version of Android before Google STOPS supporting it as outdated.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Working better than last time
reviews.comment: I tried the app a couple years ago but uninstalled after a few weeks when it slowed my whole smartphone to a crawl. So far, so good after a day with this version. One bug has shown up: Share function tries to share the *next* article, not the open article. Oops.
reviews.author: John Krog

reviews.title: Bad bug introduced
reviews.comment: After the latest update, if my screen goes black while reading an article, when I go back to the article it goes to the top. This is very annoying, especially since many of your articles are very long! Hopefully you can fix this soon!  Also in general, I think you should make the articles justified rather than left aligned.
reviews.author: Janelle Becker

reviews.title: Terrible bugs still
reviews.comment: Fixed the table of contents bug. But now every time I go back in the app the article resets to the top. And also if I tap the ads on accident I can\'t swipe to an article and must back out. Please fix these issues. Seem minor but they can really ruin the experience!!!
reviews.author: Law C

reviews.title: Can\'t share
reviews.comment: First version I\'ve ever had trouble with. Unable to share articles now. Sends the wrong article. Seems stuck on an article because always sends that link, no matter which article it is that I\'m actually trying to share :(
reviews.author: Glen Cunningham

reviews.title: Reasonable app, great content.
reviews.comment: The Economist content is fantastic. The app has a few shortcomings, like scrolling back to the top of an article when you switch apps, and no way to zoom KAL\'s cartoons. I appreciate the ability to read offline.
reviews.author: Peter Burka

reviews.title: Much improved!
reviews.comment: The most glaring bugs have been addressed in the last couple of updates. The app experience is much better.  Still in need a fix: remove vibration when tapping a link to an article from the menu, smooth out the sliding animations to be comparable to the experience on iOS (probably wishful thinking).
reviews.author: Nuno Gomes

reviews.title: Love this app and magazine, but...
reviews.comment: ... But this app is terribly supported. As an experienced software developer, I can safely say that the developers of this app have no clue whatsoever about usability or modern Dev practice in general. They fix one bug and introduce another. Repeatedly. With an idiotic 6 months between releases.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Woot
reviews.comment: Finally the long awaited update for the nexus 7. Runs good so far, looks good and sure beats reading on my 4\" phone.  And you finally fixed the supremely annoying phone issue of it returning to the top of the table of contents
reviews.author: larry b

reviews.title: Won\'t let me log in
reviews.comment: Says checking for Internet connection and then nothings.  I\'m using it on a galaxy s4 device. Fix for better score
reviews.author: Zachary Finkelstein

reviews.title: Getting Better
reviews.comment: Late August update: Now, whenever you switch away from the app (or if you turn off the screen) and come back to an article, it reloads the article so that you are scrolled back to the top. Very annoying!   The app has improved recently, especially in that it supports tablets now. It still doesn\'t have the greatest navigation or structure, and the performance is just okay. Overall it\'s pretty confusing, but it gets the job done.
reviews.author: Matt Soave

reviews.title: No Galaxy Nexus/ICS support + Battery Hog
reviews.comment: This app won\'t install on my Google-supported Galaxy Nexus phone?  Huh?  And even if I could, this thing is a total battery hog, according to widespread user reports.  This app is completely broken.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Love the content, like the app
reviews.comment: The content is superb.   I have only been using this for audio on my android phone. The recordings are professional and just what I was looking for.   The audio user interface feels like a clunky add on. It is hard to navigate.  I don\'t find it intuitive to stop, start, or start at a particular article.
reviews.author: Adam Steinfurth

reviews.title: Good but...
reviews.comment: I\'ve had this app since it came out and it\'s been fantastic. Recently (since the last update) it started resetting to the top of an article if I locked and unlocked my phone which becomes quite tedious.
reviews.author: Tom Allen

reviews.title: Ok app
reviews.comment: For such a great paper, need a better app
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Economist - you should be ashamed
reviews.comment: Well you took FOREVER to make this available on jelly bean but it\'s much improved now. However, management of downloaded issues is poor- there\'s no obvious way to know which you have or to delete them except doing it issue by issue. Given the amount of space it takes this needs more work.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great magazine, but
reviews.comment: It\'s ridiculous that you can\'t download audio on 4G. Wifi only. Defeats the purpose of mobile, no? Main reason why I reactivated my subscription. Thinking about canceling now. You should fix.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Doesnt work on Samsung Galaxy Note 8.0 cannot even access home page!!
reviews.author: Ng Aik Song
